job_title: Entry Level Software Developer - Paid Training & Career Placement - TX
job_description:
Genesis10's Dev10 Program is seeking Entry Level Software Developers! Paid Training and Career Placement for those with a STEM bachelor degree who want to learn Software Development  Genesis10's Dev10 program is an innovative training and mentoring program designed to launch careers in the fast-growing industry of Java software development. Using a cohort model, we partner with a coding bootcamp program to include paid training for candidates from diverse backgrounds with strong technical aptitude - no prior software development experience required. Those who successfully complete our rigorous training program will become salaried Dev10 Consultants for Genesis10 and will be working on exciting projects for Fortune 500 companies.  Genesis10's Dev10 program is geared towards those with STEM degrees who have been interested in software development but did not end up with a degree in computer science. If you wish you could go back to school for software development or found out too late in your degree program that you wanted to code, this could be a great program for you.  As a Dev10 Consultant with Genesis10, you will take on the critical role of turning business needs into technology solutions - from defining system requirements and designing technical solutions, to developing and testing enhancements. During training, you will learn back-end Java. You will become the creative mind behind computer programs by developing applications that add business value. You will collaborate with client and project teams to turn business requirements into detailed design specifications, and then build or enhance systems to meet their needs.  Dev10 Program Requirements   Bachelor Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics, or a non-technical degree with work experience in technology  3.0+ GPA  Desire to grow a technology skill set and learn Java software development - no prior software development experience required  Strong interpersonal and group communication  Able to commit to a 27-month program (bootcamp training  career placement)  Unlimited Work Authorization  If you think you have what it takes to be the next great Dev10 Consultant APPLY NOW!  Qualified and interested candidates should apply now for immediate consideration.  Benefits of Working with Genesis10   Medical and dental insurance available- including HSA  Bi-weekly payroll  Established consultant re-marketing program with our 50+ local clients!  401k plan  Delivery Director for employee success and support  Referral program with the opportunity to earn additional income  About Genesis10  Genesis10 is a leading Business and Technology Consulting company, headquartered in New York, with divisions across the United States including Minnesota, Milwaukee, Charlotte, Kansas City, Dallas, Des Moines, and Cleveland. We support career development through two Junior Talent Programs - G10 Associates (College-Hire) Program and Genesis10's Dev10 (Entry-Level Software Developer Training) Program. The G10 Associates program is an innovative training and mentoring program designed to launch the careers of recent college graduates. The Dev10 program takes STEM graduates with the passion and aptitude to be entry level software developers and provides training and career placement in software development - no prior coding experience required. Consultants from both programs work on exciting projects for Fortune 500 companies. To learn more about Genesis10 and our career development opportunities, please visit us at www.genesis10.comcollege-graduates  www.genesis10.comdev10-consultants.  DIG10-MN Genesis10-74123698   Start Date 02252019

CentralSquare Technologies, has an immediate need for a Software Development Engineer in Test to continue work on our Test Automation solution and to enhance its breadth and effectiveness.

Working with several product groups in multiple locations around the U.S., this engineer will use development and quality skills to develop, maintain, and execute a suite of automated regression test scripts to support our aim of continuous product regression. The current platform is a hybrid environment including SmartBear TestComplete, and VBScript.

Selected hire will provide coding support in the existing automated environment against current demand, planned growth and capacity. This is a high-impact and visible role in a fast-paced environment!

Work with Sr Automation Engineer to understand framework

Develop scripts based on Acceptance Tests from prior sprint

Manage continual execution of test scripts in a scheduled fashion to support continuous testing

Gather and maintain test data as needed

Analyze script execution results and report identified software issues to appropriate product development groups

Maintain scripts for reliability as software solutions change with each development cycle

Provide technical domain and functional knowledge of Test Automation to the QA Test teams

Ensure the quality and coverage of automation is consistent with project goals

Support broader Quality Assurance and Development goals

Requirements:

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science or related field

0-2 years of experience in software development with understanding of web technologies

Proficient in VB Script or equivalent

Knowledge of web programming technologies; JavaScript, HTML and CSS

Knowledge of SQL databases

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills

Other preferred experience, not required:

Prior experience with MVC/Web API

Prior experience with Entity Framework

Prior experience consuming and writing RESTful web services

Prior experience with JSON

Prior experience with Angular and/or JQuery

Experience working with VSTS

Job Details Division: Nucor Building Systems Indiana Location: Waterloo, IN, United States Other Available Locations: N/A Basic Job Functions: We are a Fortune 200 corporation that is well known for innovation and the leader in the design and manufacture of custom engineered metal structures. We are also among Forbes' top 50 best employers to work for in America and have a history of long term stability and sustainability. We are fast, innovative, and bursting at the seams with people passionate about what we do. We are growing rapidly and seeking enthusiastic, creative, intelligent individuals to join us. We can offer you a fun, challenging, and rewarding environment where you can contribute to the success of teammates across the nation. We climb a mountain with no top where everyone commits to continuous and never-ending improvement. If you have new ideas, let's hear them. Help us climb higher and break through barriers no one thought possible. We are seeking a self-motivated person who enjoys learning new technologies, can think outside the box, and understand impacts at an enterprise level. We are looking for someone who can take ownership of what they create and hold others accountable to the same high standards, so the end goal of adding value with long term strategy is met. Our teams are cross-functional, self-organizing, and highly autonomous. You'll be working on an agile team with stakeholders in a highly collaborative manner. This approach requires a huge amount of teamwork. You will be part of lunch and learn sessions, peer code reviews, pair programming, and other activities to foster constant learning. You will participate in innovation days for exploring new technologies or ideas and will be provided with opportunities for attending conferences and community events. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the US. Nucor is not providing a sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Candidates may be required to travel occasionally for up to a week. Safety is the most important part of all jobs within Nucor; therefore, candidates must be able to demonstrate the ability to initiate, lead, and uphold safety policies, practices, procedures, and housekeeping standards at all times. Minimum Qualifications: A minimum of 1 years of work experience using Visual Basic.NET, C#, or Java, or a 4-year degree in software development. Preferred Qualifications: Exposure to one or more of the following technologies or concepts: OOP, TDD, SOLID, WPF, XML, XSLT, ERP, Entity Framework, Microsoft SQL Server, ASP.NET, Azure or other web/cloud based programming platforms, Fortran conversion to C# Exposure to pre-engineered metal building detailing, design, or manufacturing practices and processes Exposure to Tekla Structures Building Information Modeling (BIM) platform or other 3D spatial development technologies Exposure to Microsoft Team Foundation Server as a source control and team collaboration Exposure to the principles of Scrum or other agile development practice Nucor is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - M/F/Disabled/Vets - and a drug - free workplace Nucor Corporation is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Entry-Level Software Developer (VDF/DataFlex)

Did you major in Mathematics, Engineering, or another similar logical discipline outside of Computer Science, but wished you could do-over those 4 years to be a programmer? At HCSS (based in Sugar Land [Houston], Texas), we'll PAY and TEACH you to become a Software Developer, building software products for the construction industry.

A strong propensity for programming is required. HUGE plus if you've been working on a ton of side coding projects and have the ability to think algorithmically.

During your first three months as an Entry-Level Developer, you'll go through a rigorous training program learning VDF/DataFlex programming and completing assignments to demonstrate a command of languages, libraries and other programming tools. You must be able to learn quickly and take the initiative to utilize resources outside of what is provided in order to succeed. We keep our class sizes small so you have more 1:1 attention with the instructor.

After successfully completing the training, you'll join a development team to work on our industry-leading products.

It's time to launch YOUR career with a 12x award winner of the "Best Company to Work For in Texas". With our continuous learning and educational advancement funds, we'll provide you with the resources to grow further with us. The sky's the limit on what you can achieve!

NOTE:

Part of our recruitment process includes a math/logic test. HCSS will send you an email within the week after you apply with the test link. In case this is not in your inbox, please also check your spam/junk mail folder. If this is a re-application for the same position, please utilize the test link that was sent to you in your original application.

job_title: TCS Entry Level Java Software Developer (Cleared)
job_description: Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in software engineering or a related technical field, or equivalent experience is required. Agile experience preferred. CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: Department of DefenseÂ SECRET security clearance isÂ required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required. Responsibilities for this Position General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) has an immediate opening for a Java Software Developer with 0-2 years of experience to join our Tactical Control System (TCS) team. We provide the Navy's AN/BYG-1 Submarine Combat System software to the entire submarine fleet. This position provides an opportunity to develop cutting-edge technical support for the United States Navy (USN) and Royal Australian Navy (RAN) Submarine Combat systems. Our close-knit team is passionate for delivering the best product to the Navy which directly helps the USN and RAN Sailors do their job to protect our country. Our team works closely with the Submarine community to develop solutions that allow the Navy to carry out high-stakes national security missions. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Linux Software Developers assist and participate in the research, design and development of systems software, software applications and/or tools for new and existing programs and subprograms. Responsibilities also include enhancements, modifications and corrections to existing software. In addition, these employees are responsible for coding, testing, integrating and documenting software solutions. Candidates must show a passion for innovation, a sophisticated understanding of software systems and applications, and the ability to effectively manage, grow and evolve software solutions. REQUIRED SKILLS Strong experience JAVA software development within a Linux environment Proficiency in C++ software development within a Linux environment Strong software development/coding background Working knowledge of software tools supporting Integrated Development Environments (IDE), version control, defect reporting and scripting Codes, tests, integrates and documents software solutions using Java and occasionally C++ Ability to read/write code, integrate with Linux OS, debug, test, and document Working knowledge of software engineering concepts, principles, and theories Good ability to use the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the software development life cycle to support the generation of technical engineering products PREFERRED SKILLS Experience with Jira and BitBucket Diverse programming skills including graphical programming Agile experience preferred Familiar with Navy Submarine AN/BYG-1 design Experience with Cyber security Geospatial software experience (such as ArcGIS) Proficient in using third party libraries (such as Boost) as solutions for a problem instead of â€œreinventing the wheelâ€ Company Overview General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation.Â  With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas.Â  Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency.Â  We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. Â You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded.Â  If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team! General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.Â  EOE/Disability/Veteran

Read what people are saying about working here. 

Jacobs ESSCA Group is looking for an energetic individual to support the software design of the Space Launch System Core Stage Flight Control Computers at Marshall Space Flight Center. The ideal candidate will have an established background in object-oriented design and development methodology, particularly C++ and C and UML modeling techniques. The position requires a solid understanding of software development, test, and verification disciplines.

The selected applicant will work on a customer / contractor integrated team to:

Develop and Manage UML models for the Flight Software

Participate in an agile software development environment

Review system and derived requirements and address design to code traceability

Create/Modify UML diagrams of detailed software designs

Perform software integration and unit test activities

Conduct and participate in design and code reviews

Produce weekly and monthly status reports of progress in assigned areas

The Jacobs Space Exploration Group (JSEG) offers a partnership in which you can grow personally and professionally within a framework of strong leadership, competitive compensation, and rewarding career paths. Come join our team on the Engineering Services and Science Capability Augmentation (ESSCA) contract whose work is destined to have a long-range effect on future generations!

To discover more about:

The Huntsville area, visit http://www.Huntsville.org/

Qualifications

A degree in Engineering or related field is required. Degree from an ABET accredited institution is desired. Typically, educational requirement is a BS with 0-5 years experience.

The candidate should be experienced in the following:

Experience in developing real-time embedded software

Experience with a real-time operating system (RTOS)

Excellent communication, team interaction, collaboration and problem solving skills

Leading or participating in small teams in agile software development processes

Change request systems, and the use of formal configuration management tools

Exposure to tools such as Eclipse, Subversion, and specifically previous use of UML Modeling, and automated software testing tools.

Knowledge of computer architecture

Essential Functions

Work Environment

Office and laboratory environment. Requires ability to provide clear, concise, accurate and timely communication, both verbally and in writing (100%). Requires ability to interact professionally with co-workers, management, and client (100%). Requires travel in the domestic USA (<15%).

Physical Requirements

Requires sitting for extended periods of time in meetings with peers, management, and with our client at NASA facilities to discuss technical issues (10%). Also, requires sitting for extended periods of time at a desk to write reports and perform engineering tasks (40%). Requires ability to use stairs or elevators for access between floors and multiple buildings at NASA and Jacobs facilities (10%).

Equipment and Machines

Requires ability to operate a personal computer, a telephone, fax machine, copier, calculator, and other general office equipment (100%).

Attendance

Normal workday is from 7:30 a.m. through 4:30 p.m., Monday thru Friday. Minimal overtime may be required (10%) to meet schedule milestones and to support technical demands of the job. Regular attendance is a necessity and adequate arrangements for delegating duties during absences are required.

Other Essential Functions

The ability to work independently with minimal supervision, to make rational decisions, and to exercise good judgment is essential (100%). Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk/hazard to the employee or others.

Proof of U.S. Citizenship is required.

#ESSSA

Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Jacobs is a background screening, drug-free workplace.

Requires sitting for extended periods of time in meetings with peers, management, and with our client at NASA facilities to discuss technical issues (10%). Also, requires sitting for extended periods of time at a desk to write reports and perform engineering tasks (40%). Requires ability to use stairs or elevators for access between floors and multiple buildings at NASA and Jacobs facilities (10%).

Equipment and Machines

Requires ability to operate a personal computer, a telephone, fax machine, copier, calculator, and other general office equipment (100%).

Attendance

Normal workday is from 7:30 a.m. through 4:30 p.m., Monday thru Friday. Minimal overtime may be required (10%) to meet schedule milestones and to support technical demands of the job. Regular attendance is a necessity and adequate arrangements for delegating duties during absences are required.

Other Essential Functions

The ability to work independently with minimal supervision, to make rational decisions, and to exercise good judgment is essential (100%). Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk/hazard to the employee or others.

Proof of U.S. Citizenship is required.

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. To lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Software Developers at IBM can work in a variety of areas. As such, you might be involved in any of these specialties:

Backend, Server Systems, or Cloud-Based Development â€“ Design and code servers, services, applications and databases that are reusable, scalable and meet critical architecture goals. Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use. Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large scale systems and Service Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.

Client-Facing Assistance and Solution Development â€“ Own the customer experience by solving complex business problems for the world's leading clients. Work directly with the customer to understand and troubleshoot issues, collect data, elicit detailed requirements, then design and implement innovative solutions across multiple industries and sectors, as well as governments and agencies.

Automation Development and Testing â€“ Enable continuous deployment and availability by designing, developing and creating automated frameworks, processes and test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements. Build and manage testing environments, assisting in debugging application issues.

Firmware Development â€“ Work with industry experts to design, develop and test fast and efficient software that directly manages and controls the hardware. Firmware may exist anywhere in a computing system from the central computing complex to management consoles, power supplies, and I/O adapters.

Front End Development â€“ Create high-quality web and mobile apps containing rich content and user interface components by working closely with user experience designers to take wireframes and mockups from conception to implementation. Identify specific issues in the user interface, recommending and implementing solutions that influence and improve the design of products that provide a delightful user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Full Stack Development â€“ Work across the entire system architecture, from backend to front end, to design, develop, and support high quality and scalable products. Create everything from mockups and UI components to algorithms and data structures as you deliver a complete minimally viable product.

What Youâ€™ll Do:

Youâ€™ll work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.

Youâ€™ll employ IBMâ€™s Design Thinking to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Youâ€™ll work with a variety of relational databases (SQL, Postgres, DB2, MongoDB), operating systems (Linux, Windows, iOS, Android), and modern UI frameworks (Backbone.js, AngularJS, React, Ember.js, Bootstrap, Node.js, and JQuery).

Who You Are:

You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products.

You thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and you have very strong verbal and written communication skills.

You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.

You have a basic understanding of software development and programming in a language such as Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python.

This position is located in Endicott, NY, Rochester, MN, and/or Poughkeepsie, NY

Required Professional and Technical Expertise

Must be currently participating in IBM Apprenticeship Program.

Must have basic knowledge in one of the following technology areas: Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise

None

About Business Unit

IBM Systems helps IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the worldâ€™s most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio is designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.

Your Life @ IBM

What matters to you when youâ€™re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world. What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities â€“ where you can truly discover your passion. Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust â€“ where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

The Role

Due to growth in our outsourcing business, we are looking for several software developers in full-time positions. In this role you will customize, maintain and develop new solutions to meet client requirements on BenefitConnect, our proprietary, highly sophisticated and user-friendly software, built on the .Net framework. You will consult with clients and play a key role in software development and technical support on client assignments.

You will have the opportunity to:

job_description:
We are looking for talented graduates who are hungry to be challenged and grow their skill sets. While we have been in business since 2001, we are still a young company with great growth potential and opportunity as our market and client-base expands. We need customer service oriented software developers who are leaders, problem solvers, and high achievers that go above and beyond simple project requirements.

Our software developers are asked to work on a myriad of projects with varying due dates and deadlines. These projects range in complexity and encompass internal tools, custom incentive programs for clients, new feature functionality for our core product or ancillary products, the re-architecture of our core product and other items.

As such, our developers work in all facets of the application architecture (full stack) and are eager to utilize whatever technology is necessary to get the job done efficiently and accurately. Additionally, our developers must have the ability to think on their feet and be cognizant of the bigger picture. Initiative and problem-solving skills are a must.

Developers who thrive in our environment think beyond the project requirements and deliver projects with consideration for their team, the overall customer experience, and future of our product.

We need individuals who:

Can code

Are positive team players

Willing to get their hands dirty within some older technologies

Willing to get their hands dirty working with newer technologies

Are great communicators

Have an ability to learn an established, complex product quickly

Are excited to solve problems and want to help a young company grow

Preferred Experience:
 
Nice to have:

C# / VB.NET

JavaScript / jQuery

Angular

SQL Server / T-SQL

HTML / CSS

GIT

Strong Debugging Skills

Microsoft Visual Studio

Scrum / Agile

Azure DevOps

Web API

Identity Server

React

MVC

WCF

Xamarin

XML / XSLT

Web Forms

If you have the drive to make a product better and arenâ€™t afraid to test your limits, then email your resume and cover letter to jobs@360view.com

Job Summary

SWC Technology Partners, a BDO USA Company, is a growing IT Solutions Provider. We believe that technology drives innovation, but people are what makes it a success. We are committed to creating a work culture where our employees are happy, empowered and excited to come to work every day. Our commitment to each other is why SWC is a recognized leader for our culture, employee satisfaction and career growth opportunities. Our dynamic team is made up of problem-solvers driven by a desire to help customers succeed. Weâ€™re looking for people who share that same drive and who are looking to combine teamwork with technology to produce amazing results.

This role will work with cutting edge technology, deliver high quality solutions across various local industries, and collaborate with a team working on holistic web development projects that range in size and scope, as well as receive continuous career development opportunities. This role will perform hands-on customized development and unit testing of web-based software solutions for our customers primarily based on Microsoft technologies, including but not limited to Microsoft .NET, Microsoft SQL Server and SharePoint.

Qualifications

Education:

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science or a related field from an accredited university, required

Experience:

One (1) or more years of application development experience, required

Experience with C#, Java, Microsoft Development Platforms, SQL and SQL Server, required

Experience writing and optimizing SQL queries, required

Experience with Mobile development and/or Xamarin, preferred

Experience with Visual Studio, Microsoft MVC and entity framework, preferred

Experience developing with SharePoint solutions, preferred

Experience with Java, Apex, PHP, JavaScript, CSS, or HTML, preferred

Software:

Experience with one of the following:

.Net, C#, MVC, Java, SQL, SQL Server

Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP)

Experience within a consultative environment

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Must be open to travel to client sites, if needed

Keywords: .Net, ASP.Net, C#, MVC, Java, Microsoft Development, SQL, PHP, Visual Studio, SharePoint, Java, Apex, Xamarine, Mobile

job_description:
Position Description

The Software Developer creates and modifies code for Dakota Software's products. This individual analyzes user needs and develops customized software solutions for specific client use, all with the aim of optimizing operational efficiency. Long-term this role will grow into working on the development of new features or enhancements in Dakota's proprietary technology.

Responsibilities

Perform custom programming at customer request

Take instruction from senior developers on system design, and follow guidelines on project limitations and capabilities, and performance requirements

Code quality applications following technical specifications using the appropriate tools

Understand business, technical, and infrastructure requirements

Create and maintain accurate documentation of infrastructure, and technical solutions

Provide status updates to senior team members on a regular basis

Clearly escalate issues and risks to appropriate teams as needed

Participate in code reviews, and adhere to coding standards and best practices

Remain knowledgeable on current and emerging industry and market trends

Qualifications

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other related field, or equivalent work experience

Minimum internship experience in software development preferred

Experience with Object Oriented programming

Experience with Relational Databases preferred

Experience with ASP.NET, C#, SQL Server, JavaScript, HTML, JQuery and Crystal Reports preferred

Limited knowledge of Visual Studio

Ability to follow instructions, and proven methods or techniques to software development

Understanding of the basic concepts of version control features in Git (e.g. repository, working copies, versioning, etc.)

Basic understanding of test automation, with ability to write basic unit tests for work being completed

Ability to write straight line code with copy paste for reuse

Ability to provide some organization within a file

Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form

Ability to process information logically

Skilled in time management to meet close deadlines

Understanding of, or exposure to Agile Development preferred

Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship

Location: Cleveland, OH 44115

Dakota Software Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with federal, state, and local laws, we will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis including, but not limited to, ethnic background, age, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, non- job related handicap/disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or military status.

Applications are not intended to, and do not create a contract or offer of employment. If hired, employment with the company will be on an at-will basis.

job_title: Entry Level Full Stack Software Developer
job_description:
Read what people are saying about working here. 
Labatt Food Service is now hiring entry level full stack Software Developers.

Are you looking for a fun career in software development and knowing that your efforts directly impact the success of the business? Do you want to work in small teams where you are part of the design and direction of the projects? Do you want to work with smart people and grow with the group, sharing your knowledge and learning from others? Do you have a passion for writing code and finding solutions to difficult problems?

At Labatt Food Service we consider ourselves a sophisticated software company that sells food, and our track record speaks for itself. We continue to grow every year and succeed against competitors 50 times our size by being innovators and building long term, respectful relationships with our customers, vendors and employees. Though we are smaller than some larger competitors, we are often first to market with new technologies. Many of our new initiatives eventually become standard across the industry, and we have thus established an unrivaled reputation as being a thought-leader in our industry.

Role & Responsibilities

Labattâ€™s developers create and continuously improve all the systems that run the business. Software and data analytics play a huge part in the success of the company, and therefore software developers have a significant impact on the company. Since the very beginning, Labatt has focused on writing all of its own code, allowing the company to move quickly into new areas and be flexible to customer needs. Our team of software developers design, test, and continually re-engineer the critical systems that keep all aspects of the business running at full steam. Developers work as members of small teams, and employ Agile methodologies to bring about the internal-efficiency and customer-facing innovations that are necessary to keep our lead in the industry. Our philosophy of investing in clean code and developing people from within allows us to build for the long term and leverage the most forward-thinking APIs, languages, and practices, to take on the most intellectually challenging projects that our industry faces.

As a software developer at Labatt, you will take on projects approximately 6 months in length, iterate on a small team of 3-5, test thoroughly, design clean & modular code, experiment, learn, be challenged, and serve the needs of the business. All developers are expected to contribute to the team's success by solving non-trivial problems and sharing lessons learned with the group. Developers are also expected to follow the group's established coding and process best practices as established by the group to ensure quality and consistent code - code that will last for many years. That said, developers have a significant amount of freedom over their projects and the ability to experiment with newer technologies and practices that may help the group overall.

About Labatt Food Service:

Labatt Food Service, founded in 1968 and headquartered in San Antonio, Texas is a privately owned company and the tenth largest foodservice distributor in the nation, servicing food-away-from-home customers in five states. The company currently has over 1600 employees and over 6000 customers, including school districts, military bases, restaurant chains, convenience store chains, and individual outlets. Over the 50+ years Labatt has existed as a B2B food distribution and logistics company, sales have grown from $8 million to over $1.3B annually and we expect to continue to grow each year.

Our Current Stack

Developers at Labatt Food Service use a variety of technologies, including:

C#, Visual Basic, Golang, IBM RPG, Vue.js, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, and SQL.

Requirements

The developers who do best at Labatt must have the ability to think both strategically and tactically, the discipline to set and hit deadlines, an appetite for hard work and continuous personal improvement, a passion for working and effectively communicating with others, and a commitment to the success of the overall organization.

Proficiency in coding and the ability to write clean, functional code is a must, although we train everyone to our particular style and needs. We understand that developers learn and use different technologies over time. We are more interested in finding developers who can think and write code and are less interested in "X years with Y technology". No matter the starting skill level, developers are expected to improve over time.

A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field is required.

Entry level developers work in teams with more experienced developers and are expected to contribute to user stories as well as the implementation and design of the software projects.

Here is the link to our online application: http://apply.labattfood.com/
 Labatt Food Service is now hiring entry level full stack Software Developers.

Are you looking for a fun career in software development and knowing that your efforts directly impact the success of the business? Do you want to work in small teams where you are part of the design and direction of the projects? Do you want to work with smart people and grow with the group, sharing your knowledge and learning from others? Do you have a passion for writing code and finding solutions to difficult problems?

At Labatt Food Service we consider ourselves a sophisticated software company that sells food, and our track record speaks for itself. We continue to grow every year and succeed against competitors 50 times our size by being innovators and building long term, respectful relationships with our customers, vendors and employees. Though we are smaller than some larger competitors, we are often first to market with new technologies. Many of our new initiatives eventually become standard across the industry, and we have thus established an unrivaled reputation as being a thought-leader in our industry.

Role & Responsibilities

Labattâ€™s developers create and continuously improve all the systems that run the business. Software and data analytics play a huge part in the success of the company, and therefore software developers have a significant impact on the company. Since the very beginning, Labatt has focused on writing all of its own code, allowing the company to move quickly into new areas and be flexible to customer needs. Our team of software developers design, test, and continually re-engineer the critical systems that keep all aspects of the business running at full steam. Developers work as members of small teams, and employ Agile methodologies to bring about the internal-efficiency and customer-facing innovations that are necessary to keep our lead in the industry. Our philosophy of investing in clean code and developing people from within allows us to build for the long term and leverage the most forward-thinking APIs, languages, and practices, to take on the most intellectually challenging projects that our industry faces.

As a software developer at Labatt, you will take on projects approximately 6 months in length, iterate on a small team of 3-5, test thoroughly, design clean & modular code, experiment, learn, be challenged, and serve the needs of the business. All developers are expected to contribute to the team's success by solving non-trivial problems and sharing lessons learned with the group. Developers are also expected to follow the group's established coding and process best practices as established by the group to ensure quality and consistent code - code that will last for many years. That said, developers have a significant amount of freedom over their projects and the ability to experiment with newer technologies and practices that may help the group overall.

About Labatt Food Service:

Labatt Food Service, founded in 1968 and headquartered in San Antonio, Texas is a privately owned company and the tenth largest foodservice distributor in the nation, servicing food-away-from-home customers in five states. The company currently has over 1600 employees and over 6000 customers, including school districts, military bases, restaurant chains, convenience store chains, and individual outlets. Over the 50+ years Labatt has existed as a B2B food distribution and logistics company, sales have grown from $8 million to over $1.3B annually and we expect to continue to grow each year.

Our Current Stack

Developers at Labatt Food Service use a variety of technologies, including:

C#, Visual Basic, Golang, IBM RPG, Vue.js, MySQL, RabbitMQ, Docker, and SQL.

Requirements

The developers who do best at Labatt must have the ability to think both strategically and tactically, the discipline to set and hit deadlines, an appetite for hard work and continuous personal improvement, a passion for working and effectively communicating with others, and a commitment to the success of the overall organization.

Proficiency in coding and the ability to write clean, functional code is a must, although we train everyone to our particular style and needs. We understand that developers learn and use different technologies over time. We are more interested in finding developers who can think and write code and are less interested in "X years with Y technology". No matter the starting skill level, developers are expected to improve over time.

A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field is required.

Entry level developers work in teams with more experienced developers and are expected to contribute to user stories as well as the implementation and design of the software projects.

Introduction

Your Role and Responsibilities

START DATES FOR THIS POSITION ARE FEBRUARY 2019 AND LATER.

At IBM we have an amazing opportunity to transform the world with cognitive technology. By using the vast amounts of information available today to identify new patterns and make new discoveries, we are helping cities become smarter, hospitals transform patient care, financial institutions minimize risk, and pharmaceuticals find cures for rare diseases. Join the forward-thinking teams at IBM solving some of the worldâ€™s most complex problems â€“ there is no better place to grow your career!

Software Developers at IBM can work in a variety of areas. As such, you might be involved in any of these specialties:

Backend, Server Systems, or Cloud-Based Development â€“ Design and code servers, services, applications and databases that are reusable, scalable and meet critical architecture goals. Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use. Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large scale systems and Service Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.

Client-Facing Assistance and Solution Development â€“ Own the customer experience by solving complex business problems for the world's leading clients. Work directly with the customer to understand and troubleshoot issues, collect data, elicit detailed requirements, then design and implement innovative solutions across multiple industries and sectors, as well as governments and agencies.

Automation Development and Testing â€“ Enable continuous deployment and availability by designing, developing and creating automated frameworks, processes and test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements. Build and manage testing environments, assisting in debugging application issues.

Firmware Development â€“ Work with industry experts to design, develop and test fast and efficient software that directly manages and controls the hardware. Firmware may exist anywhere in a computing system from the central computing complex to management consoles, power supplies, and I/O adapters.

Front End Development â€“ Create high-quality web and mobile apps containing rich content and user interface components by working closely with user experience designers to take wireframes and mockups from conception to implementation. Identify specific issues in the user interface, recommending and implementing solutions that influence and improve the design of products that provide a delightful user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Full Stack Development â€“ Work across the entire system architecture, from backend to front end, to design, develop, and support high quality and scalable products. Create everything from mockups and UI components to algorithms and data structures as you deliver a complete minimally viable product.

Entry-Level Software Developers are in demand across IBM's growth areas. You'll be matched and deployed to a development team in a strategic business, based on your offered location and fit. These are office-based positions in IBM locations including:

AZ - Tuscon, Phoenix

CA - Almaden, Costa Mesa, Emeryville, Foster City, San Francisco, San Jose

CO - Denver

GA - Atlanta, Brookhaven, Sandy Springs

IL - Chicago

MA - Cambridge, Littleton

MN - Rochester

NC - Raleigh-Durham

NY - New York City, North Castle/Armonk, Poughkeepsie, Yorktown Heights, Endicott

OH - Dublin

OR - Hillsboro

PA - Blue Bell, Pittsburgh

TX - Austin, Dallas, Irving, Houston

VT - Essex Junction

WI - Hartland

Opportunities in these locations will vary based on business demand.

What Youâ€™ll Do:

Youâ€™ll work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.

Youâ€™ll employ IBMâ€™s Design Thinking and Agile methodologies to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Youâ€™ll work with a variety of relational databases (SQL, Postgres, DB2, MongoDB), operating systems (Linux, Windows, iOS, Android), and modern UI frameworks (Backbone.js, AngularJS, React, Ember.js, Bootstrap, Node.js, and JQuery).

Who You Are:

You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products.

You thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and you have very strong verbal and written communication skills.

You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.

You have a basic understanding of software development and programming in a language such as Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python.

Required Professional and Technical Expertise

Must have basic knowledge in one of the following technology areas: Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise

Willing to travel up to 10%

Bachelors or Masters Degree

Identify specific issues in the user interface, recommending and implementing solutions that influence and improve the design of products that provide a delightful user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Full Stack Development â€“ Work across the entire system architecture, from backend to front end, to design, develop, and support high quality and scalable products. Create everything from mockups and UI components to algorithms and data structures as you deliver a complete minimally viable product.

What Youâ€™ll Do:

CGI: An employer of choice

Position Description:

CGI is seeking an Entry Level Software Developer who will be part of a team developing a platform that will radically transform and modernize our industry clients! If you are PASSIONATE about creating something AMAZING â€“ this career opportunity may be for you!

Your future duties and responsibilities:

Are you an aspiring developer who loves to learn? Do you host your own web application(s)? Do you find yourself constantly trying to automate and improve what you have? Do you look at complex systems and immediately start trying to work out the individual components, their relationships to each other, and how they all work together?

If you are the kind of person who wants to understand technology from the silicon to the browser, then we may have a job for you.

This is an entry level role ideal for a new or aspiring developer with diverse interests and a desire to learn and grow. Primary responsibilities for individuals in this role will be to make individual contributions within a cross-functional team, taking direction from mid and senior developers, software development engineers in test, and the team lead. These contributions will primarily take the forms of software development and system / software configuration tasks, creation of documentation, and automation of tests.

Individuals in this role are expected to hone and augment skills and experience in preparation for advancement to mid-level developers, contribute to the self-governance of the team and generally take part in running the day-to-day activities of the team. All team members are expected to contribute in every other capacity on the team as needed, including other duties as assigned.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

Candidates should possess the following core competencies:

Strong general computing skills

At least one programming language, at least one of which should be C# or Java

Understanding of appropriate unit testing framework(s) for known language(s) (appropriate XUnit)

Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

General familiarity with SQL and SQL DBEs

Strong interpersonal and communication skills

Knowledge of XML, HTML, and related technologies (XSLT, CSS, etc.)

Highly motivated self-learner

Basic knowledge of Linux, preferably Red Hat or CentOS

At least one scripting language (Bash, Perl, Powershell, Javascript, etc.)

Basic understanding of Regular Expressions

Team player that can work individually

Basic understanding of at least one build tool (Ant, Maven, MSBuild, etc.)

Basic understanding of version control, preferably with Git

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

The ideal candidate should also have the following:

Understanding of Object Oriented Design

Understanding of design patterns and paradigms

General familiarity with protocols, patterns, and paradigms of microservices (REST, SOAP, etc.)

High level understanding of OAuth and / or SAML, preferably with AD /LDAP / Kerberos

Basic understanding of Virtualization (VMWare, HyperV, VirtualBox)

Familiarity with network storage (NAS, SAN, and related concepts, protocols, etc.)

Windows Server Administration

Linux / Unix Server Administration

Monitoring (Solarwinds, Nagios, Kaseya, etc.)

Basic TCP/IP Networking (DHCP, Subnetting, CIDR, Basic Routing, DNS, Basics of firewalls, etc.)

Familiarity with at least one Web or application server (Apache httpd, IIS, Apache Tomcat, Glassfish, etc.)

A drive to automate

Our dream candidate would also have the following:

Various certifications (AWS, CompTIA, Cisco, Microsoft, etc.)

Troubleshooting experience

Familiarity with at least one cloud service provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, etc.)

Documentation skills

A good understanding of version control and related concepts and techniques

This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit participation and stock purchase plans.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, gender Identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, or other status protected by law

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. To lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Software Developers at IBM can work in a variety of areas. As such, you might be involved in any of these specialties:

Backend, Server Systems, or Cloud-Based Development â€“ Design and code servers, services, applications and databases that are reusable, scalable and meet critical architecture goals. Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use. Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large scale systems and Service Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.

Client-Facing Assistance and Solution Development â€“ Own the customer experience by solving complex business problems for the world's leading clients. Work directly with the customer to understand and troubleshoot issues, collect data, elicit detailed requirements, then design and implement innovative solutions across multiple industries and sectors, as well as governments and agencies.

Automation Development and Testing â€“ Enable continuous deployment and availability by designing, developing and creating automated frameworks, processes and test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements. Build and manage testing environments, assisting in debugging application issues.

Firmware Development â€“ Work with industry experts to design, develop and test fast and efficient software that directly manages and controls the hardware. Firmware may exist anywhere in a computing system from the central computing complex to management consoles, power supplies, and I/O adapters.

Front End Development â€“ Create high-quality web and mobile apps containing rich content and user interface components by working closely with user experience designers to take wireframes and mockups from conception to implementation. Identify specific issues in the user interface, recommending and implementing solutions that influence and improve the design of products that provide a delightful user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Full Stack Development â€“ Work across the entire system architecture, from backend to front end, to design, develop, and support high quality and scalable products. Create everything from mockups and UI components to algorithms and data structures as you deliver a complete minimally viable product.

What Youâ€™ll Do:

Youâ€™ll work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.

Youâ€™ll employ IBMâ€™s Design Thinking to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Youâ€™ll work with a variety of relational databases (SQL, Postgres, DB2, MongoDB), operating systems (Linux, Windows, iOS, Android), and modern UI frameworks (Backbone.js, AngularJS, React, Ember.js, Bootstrap, Node.js, and JQuery).

Who You Are:

You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products.

You thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and you have very strong verbal and written communication skills.

You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.

You have a basic understanding of software development and programming in a language such as Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python.

Required Professional and Technical Expertise

Must be currently participating in IBM Apprenticeship Program.

Must have basic knowledge in one of the following technology areas: Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise

None

About Business Unit

Digitization is accelerating the ongoing evolution of business, and clouds - public, private, and hybrid - enable companies to extend their existing infrastructure and integrate across systems. IBM Cloud provides the security, control, and visibility that our clients have come to expect. We are working to provide the right tools and environment to combine all of our clientâ€™s data, no matter where it resides, to respond to changing market dynamics.

Your Life @ IBM

What matters to you when youâ€™re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world. What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities â€“ where you can truly discover your passion. Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust â€“ where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM

IBMâ€™s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

job_description:
GDIT is currently seeking a Digital Repository Developer in Bethesda, MD to join our team. In this role you will be an entry level developer on the Digital Repository development team at the National Library of Medicine (NLM). The Digital Repository digitally preserves and makes accessible content at the NLM, including books, films and images.

Task and responsibilities in this role include, but are not limited to the following:

Customize and develop software to allow library curators to build online exhibits and manage metadata.

Develop software for repository data processing, including code to obtain, create, parse and transform text, XML, pdf and binary files, and to invoke document, image and video manipulation routines.

Migrate data from existing digital exhibition systems to the NLM Digital Repository.

Develop software to automate and integrate the above processes, using toolsets such as Camel.

Develop application code to integrate with open source and third-party systems for data retrieval, replication, and task automation, scheduling and status.

Develop prototype and production user interfaces using Ruby on Rails, Django, or Java.

Develop and execute software unit and test cases to test system functionality, performance, security and scalability.

Store and version source code using the project version control tool.

To qualify, you must meet these basic qualifications:

Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

Familiarity with HTML, JavaScript, and a UNIX shell environment

It would be great if you also had:

Prefer degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or other technical field

Knowledge of Java, Ruby on Rails, Django or Python

Familiarity with UNIX shell scripting, RDF, XML, XSLT, REST, and HTTP

Familiarity with open-source software tools, such as Fedora Commons, Solr, Blacklight, Camel, Loris, Internet Archive BookReader, Apache, Tomcat, Karaf, and MySQL

job_description:
Introduction

N/A

Your Role and Responsibilities

At IBM we have an amazing opportunity to transform the world with cognitive technology. By using the vast amounts of information available today to identify new patterns and make new discoveries, we are helping cities become smarter, hospitals transform patient care, financial institutions minimize risk, and pharmaceuticals find cures for rare diseases. Join the forward-thinking teams at IBM solving some of the worldâ€™s most complex problems â€“ there is no better place to grow your career!

Software Developers at IBM can work in a variety of areas. As such, you might be involved in any of these specialties:

Backend, Server Systems, or Cloud-Based Development â€“ Design and code servers, services, applications and databases that are reusable, scalable and meet critical architecture goals. Create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that are clean, well-documented, and easy to use. Create and configure Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. Design and implement large scale systems and Service Oriented Architectures (SOA) that enable continuous delivery.

Client-Facing Assistance and Solution Development â€“ Own the customer experience by solving complex business problems for the world's leading clients. Work directly with the customer to understand and troubleshoot issues, collect data, elicit detailed requirements, then design and implement innovative solutions across multiple industries and sectors, as well as governments and agencies.

Automation Development and Testing â€“ Enable continuous deployment and availability by designing, developing and creating automated frameworks, processes and test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements. Build and manage testing environments, assisting in debugging application issues.

Firmware Development â€“ Work with industry experts to design, develop and test fast and efficient software that directly manages and controls the hardware. Firmware may exist anywhere in a computing system from the central computing complex to management consoles, power supplies, and I/O adapters.

Front End Development â€“ Create high-quality web and mobile apps containing rich content and user interface components by working closely with user experience designers to take wireframes and mockups from conception to implementation. Identify specific issues in the user interface, recommending and implementing solutions that influence and improve the design of products that provide a delightful user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Full Stack Development â€“ Work across the entire system architecture, from backend to front end, to design, develop, and support high quality and scalable products. Create everything from mockups and UI components to algorithms and data structures as you deliver a complete minimally viable product.

Entry-Level Software Developers are in demand across IBM's growth areas. You'll be matched and deployed to a development team in a strategic business, based on your offered location and fit. These are office-based positions in IBM locations including:

AZ - Tuscon, Phoenix

CA - Almaden, Costa Mesa, Emeryville, Foster City, San Francisco, San Jose

CO - Denver

GA - Atlanta, Brookhaven, Sandy Springs

IL - Chicago

MA - Cambridge, Littleton

MN - Rochester

NC - Raleigh-Durham

NY - New York City, North Castle/Armonk, Poughkeepsie, Yorktown Heights, Endicott

OH - Dublin

OR - Hillsboro

PA - Blue Bell, Pittsburgh

TX - Austin, Dallas, Irving, Houston

VT - Essex Junction

WI - Hartland

Opportunities in these locations will vary based on business demand.

What Youâ€™ll Do:

Youâ€™ll work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.

Youâ€™ll employ IBMâ€™s Design Thinking and Agile methodologies to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Youâ€™ll work with a variety of relational databases (SQL, Postgres, DB2, MongoDB), operating systems (Linux, Windows, iOS, Android), and modern UI frameworks (Backbone.js, AngularJS, React, Ember.js, Bootstrap, Node.js, and JQuery).

Who You Are:

You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products.

You thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and you have very strong verbal and written communication skills.

You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.

You have a basic understanding of software development and programming in a language such as Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python.

Required Professional and Technical Expertise

Must have basic knowledge in one of the following technology areas: Java, Javascript, C, C++, or Python

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise

Willing to travel up to 10%

Bachelors or Masters Degree

UWorld is a worldwide leader in online test prep practice question banks. Since 2003, over a million students have trusted us to help them prepare for high-stakes examinations.

UWorld is seeking a motivated Software Developer who will make an immediate impact to our web-based, exam-preparation company. Successful candidates will enjoy problem solving and have experience in design, development, testing, and deployment of interactive web applications.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum Education:

Recent graduate of a bachelor's or master's degree program in computer science or related field

Minimum Experience:

Working knowledge/experience utilizing the following: C# and/or Java, .NET, HTML, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery, Angular JS, REST services, and SQL Server

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English

Excellent interpersonal skills demonstrating ability to articulate ideas clearly, concisely, and persuasively

Excellent attention to detail and organization skills

Ability to work effectively within a changing environment that is going through high growth

Ability to understand direction and feedback

Exceptional follow-through, personal drive, and the desire to make a difference

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Software Developer will perform the following duties:

Develop and test end-to-end web applications (from prototype to deployment) or contribute to the development of existing web applications in terms of new feature enhancements

Design and develop web-based interactive front-end for existing web-applications (USMLE, BOARD, NCLEX, MCAT, SAT & ACT question banks) or create UI for new applications (MBE bar exam, Advanced placements, CPA/CFA test preparation) using AngularJS, BootStrap, HTML, CSS, JavaScript (and other related API).

Develop, enhance or rebuild responsive UWorld web portal to enhance user purchase experience, highlight product features, provide client (end-user) support or any other functionality vital for an efficient ecommerce transaction.

Build responsive user interface (UI) screens that scale across all devices (Phone, Tablet and Computer).

Employ best practices for code sharing and development to ensure common code base abstraction across all applications.

Consume/Develop REST and/or SOAP services to provide interactive experience for end user with real-time data related to test preparation and e-commerce activities.

Work with QA engineers to ensure quality and reliability of all apps by process of continuous improvement.

Environment: C#, .NET, Angular JS, jQuery/JavaScript, CSS, HTML, REST services,

Develop, modify, and test algorithms that can be employed in computer programs to store, locate, and retrieve specific documents, data, and information

Validate and process all data communication between clients(applications) and server to ensure data integrity and retrieval using RDMS (SQL Server) and/or JSON objects

Provide mechanism for end users to search product-specific materials and show them in User Interface for review.

Display data received from service calls and provide end-user with ancillary features that help in data retrieving, searching and filtering.

Review the bug report compiled by customer care team and the priority set by Sr. Software Engineer to fix them.

Environment: C#, .NET, jQuery/JavaScript, HTML, REST services, SQL Server (Working knowledge)

Collaborate with other developers, engineers, and subject matter experts in maintaining existing web applications and website portal and to build new application prototypes

Create digital wireframes using Visual Studio, marvelapps or proto.io for new features in existing Web apps, web portals (UWorld website, UWorld CMS, UWorld Support) or to document requirements for new/future products.

Work with a team of software engineers to achieve quality and on-time releases.

Collaborate with technical architects, product leads, QA team and customer care team to drive new enhancements or fix bugs in a timely manner.

Involve in discussions related to new app development or application prototype for future UWorld products or any related web portals.

Environment: CSS, HTML, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, proto.io or marvelapps (optional)

Ensure continuous product improvement via user feedback and platform-based research. Also ensure consistent functionality across all modalities of client-server interaction

Continuously review other platform specific features (mainly Android and iOS) to see if the same can be implemented in web platform (e.g., Flashcards, Highlights, Strikeout of the contents and saving those user actions at granular level for future reference).

Understand the cross-platform functionality support so all applications provide consistent user experience.

Learn from Sr. Software Engineers on market research in order to provide cutting-edge features to users

Review end user feedback on a continuous basis to ensure early detection of user concerns as well as gauge product popularity and development direction.

Statement of Supervision:

Software Developer will check in with Sr. Software Engineer(s) on weekly basis to provide updates and to report issues or concerns related to application development:

Update task list periodically (on an as-needed basis) with up-to-date status updates using tools like Visual Studio Team Services, Agile Central, or any other project management tool as indicated by Sr. Software Engineer.

Incorporate and implement optimizations as suggested by development team and/or Sr. Software Engineer as part of Code Review process.

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:

Compensation on par with industry standards

Paid time off (based on sliding scale according to hire date and work hours)

Generous paid holiday schedule that includes the entire week of Christmas off.

Comprehensive benefits package (medical, vision, dental, life, disability)

401(k) plan for retirement with 4% employer matching (eligibility after 90 days of employment)

On-site group fitness classes & relaxed work environment

Progeny Systems is a privately held, high-tech small business that provides premium systems, services, and products for the Department of Defense, government agencies and commercial clients. National Aeronautics & Space Administration (NASA)

job_title: Entry Level - Automation and Testing Software Developer
job_description:
Introduction

Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Your Role and Responsibilities

START DATES FOR THIS POSITION ARE IN 2020

As an Entry Level Automation Development and Testing Software Developer you will:

Work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.

Employ IBMâ€™s Design Thinking to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.

Enable continuous deployment and availability by designing, developing and creating automated frameworks, processes and test cases based on functional and end-user requirements.

Build and manage testing environments, assisting in debugging application issues.

Implement software that tests and stresses on-premise products and/or cloud services for end users.

Who You Are:

You are highly motivated and have a passion for creating and supporting great products.

You thrive on collaboration, working side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines, and you have very strong verbal and written communication skills.

You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.

You have a basic understanding of software development and programming languages

Entry-Level Automation Development and Testing Software Developers are in demand across IBM's growth areas. You'll be matched to a development team based on your skills, location preference, and business needs. Positions are based in one of the following IBM offices:

AZ - Tucson*

CA - Costa Mesa*, Emeryville, Foster City, San Francisco*, San Jose

CO - Denver*

GA - Atlanta, Sandy Springs

IL - Chicago*

MA - Cambridge, Littleton

MN - Rochester

NC - Durham, Raleigh

NY - Endicott, Hopewell Junction, North Castle*, Manhattan*, Poughkeepsie, Yorktown Heights

OH - Dublin

PA - Blue Bell, Pittsburgh*

TX - Austin, Dallas, Houston, Irving*

Opportunities in all locations will vary based on business demand

cities with limited opportunities.

Required Professional and Technical Expertise

Must have basic knowledge in one or more of the following technology areas: C++, C, Java, Ruby, Python.

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise

Basic knowledge of automation tools and testing frameworks

Willing to travel up to 10%

Bachelors or Masters Degree

About Business Unit

No matter where you work in IBM, you are making an impact. As an Early Professional with IBM, you will be taking on a key role with one of our industry-leading business units to work on the technology that is solving our most challenging problems and changing the way the world thinks.

Your Life @ IBM

What matters to you when youâ€™re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities â€“ where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust â€“ where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM

IBMâ€™s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
